Reviews.Title: “Honestly not your best bet in the YVR area!”
Reviews.Author: BuccaneerDave
Reviews.Content: Despite the protestations of the Manager in previous reviews here, this property has very poor cleanliness and maintenance standards. This hotel was chosen for our group otherwise, after reading the TA reviews prior to our stay, we would not have stayed. There are good reasons that over 50% of the the TA reviews for this hotel are rated average or lower. The property is dirty on the outside and this trend continues into the interior of the hotel. The stairway from the underground parking upwards is one of the filthest I have ever seen in a Canadian hotel. The walls are dirty, the carpets copiously stained and the doors and door jams are disgusting. The hallway walls are dirty and beat up. Each of the rooms we stayed in (2 different rooms on 2 different nights) were dirty. Grimy fingerprints everywhere. Carpets that feely sticky. Hairs in the bathroom and shower. You just get a general feeling of uncleanliness and neglect. We looked at several other rooms that our group had and the problems are consistent throughout. The building and rooms are not properly maintained. Doors do not close or lock properly. Spackle coming off the ceilings. Water stains on the ceiling. Fridges that rattle throughout the night. Shabby furniture. Peeling wallpaper. The walls are paper thin and if you do stay in a 1st or 2nd floor room you will hear the folks above you. The hallways have uneven tile floors and the sound of any pulled luggage resonates throughout your room. We did not have the breakfast the first morning we were there but were aware that we would be leaving too early to have it. You may be able to get a bagged breakfast if you request it the evening before. On our second morning we did go into the restaurant and unfortunately, though some of our friends ate there, we would have gone elsewhere. It was just not an appealing place to eat. The morning that we did take the shuttle the airport the bus was nearly 20 minutes behind schedule and was full enough that it left a group behind at the hotel. I suspect that the shuttle is a 3rd party contractor so this may not be a fault of the hotel but if one is staying at this property for the shuttle you may need to be reassured that you will be able to get to the airport when you need to be there. Upon our return we arrived at 1 am and were aware that the shuttle was not operating. The cab fare is $15, with tip, from YVR. In previous experiences at other hotels in the area they will reimburse you for the fare. This was not offered to us. It does provide reassurance that there is a night watchmen, but the fact that they need one is disconcerting. One of our group had their vehicle broken into and a bag taken from the truck and a second bag was misplaced in another room while our friends were at breakfast. We have stayed at several other YVR area hotels and both the Holiday Inn Express and the Accent Inn offer similar amenities (free parking, shuttle, breakfast) at a similar price in a much, much different environment (clean, friendly, well maintained, safe, secure) that really this property should not be on your radar. It truly disappoints me to have to write this review but honestly this is a very poorly run hotel and the problems we experienced were too numerous to discuss with the front desk staff or management. In good conscience, and as a service to fellow TA readers and contributors, we would not recommend this property to any one, especially since there are many other excellent choices in the immediate neighbourhood.

Reviews.Title: “No shuttle. No breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: ginagoldie
Reviews.Content: There are several hotels in this price range to choose from. Pay the extra $20 to stay somewhere else! The hotel advertises a free shuttle from the airport, but in the fine print somewhere they do not have the shuttle between midnight and 4am. I found this out at 1am, after struggling out alone to the shuttle stop in the rain with a grumpy 4 year old and all our baggage. The hotel staff were completely non-apologetic. They also did not call my room to advise me the morning shuttle was there (which I requested), and it left promptly at 6am (the scheduled arrival time) so when I got there 4 minutes later it was gone and I had to take another cab back. No sign of the advertised included breakfast either.

Reviews.Title: “stay away”
Reviews.Author: SNMD
Reviews.Content: Very cheesy. My room smelled, shabby furniture and bathroom. The lining were not from the laundry. Someone already slept on it. I slept with my cloth on. It’s rather a homeless shelter

Reviews.Title: “Great value and convenient for Vancouver Airport travel”
Reviews.Author: KTColleen
Reviews.Content: Our hotel stay was reasonably priced to begin with, but add in the free shuttle to and from the airport, the free hot breakfast for booking online, and the welcoming wine tasting and it is a fantastic deal. The hotel manager hosted the wine tasting and it provided an great opportunity to mingle with other guests.

Reviews.Title: “COLD AND LOUD, Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: Dara86
Reviews.Content: FIRST of all the front desk was rude!! We stayed here Jan. 31 and checked in pretty late there was no one else in the lobby then us but for some reason the guy that was checking us in was just so distracted and rude. We felt like we were bother him by just arriving. SECOND the rooms are out dated I felt like i was staying at 1 star hotel not a 21/2 - 3. THIRD the rooms were soooooo loud it was complete impossible to sleep at all. We felt like we were sleep outside we could hear everything so clearly. For most people staying at this hotel your staying here to be close to the airport because you have a flight the next day well try having a flight early and get completely no sleep the night before; it sucks. The only good thing about this hotel is that it included early shuttle pick up for the airport. Dont stay here if you dont want rude service, feel gross about staying in the room and bed, and want no sleep the night before a flight!!!!! Spend the extra $10-$20 and stay at a much better place!!!

Reviews.Title: “more of a motel 6 than an executive inn but clean”
Reviews.Author: natalie73
Reviews.Content: This motel is clean, standard size, standard issue hotel furniture. very clean and although they've tried to pain over bits here and there, you can tell it's older. It's cheap enough I suppose, $99 included a week parking and there's a fee airport shuttle and you can leave your winter coats and clothes for the trip home with them if you don't want to lug it all to mexico which was handy. parkade seemed safe enough as even our old easy to break into jeep wasn't broken into in week, no security gates or anything though. we missed our airport shuttle the first time as the shower had no cold water, only scalding hot and no matter what we did, as soon as we got any cold water there wasn't enough water pressure to run the shower. we stayed in 323 which was super quite but 306 on our way back must have faced a different street as there was a lot of traffic noise. also, a couple of skids approached us inthe lobby at 7 am and asked us if we wanted to make $300 by paying them $200 for a preloaded visa with $500 on it. First of all how dumb are you..and second, nice clientele!! The manager just rolled his eyes wheras I would have kicked them out. he did credit me $20 for cab far we had to spend due to missing the shuttle though which was ok. I'd probably spend an extra $10 or $20 and stay somewhere a bit newer next time. it's fine though, clean and comfortable enough for one night.

Reviews.Title: “Value for your room cost”
Reviews.Author: Pearl R
Reviews.Content: The room we had was very large and clean for the cost of the room. Everything was very clean and quiet. For a older Inn this is a quality one. The staff are friendly and helpful. We will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, but no frills accommodation”
Reviews.Author: graftongal
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on 12/21/2011 for a night after flying from the UK before starting our car trip the next day so only wanted a clean bed and bathroom. The frontage of the building looks nice from the road, but it was apparent on entry that it was in need of rennovation. The lobby carpet and furniture were very shabby. The rooms were large and the beds were comfortable and the furniture was ok but very dated. That was not a real issue, but the sheets were creased (and thin) ,which may have been from a dryer but not too appealing for a hotel stay. the rooms opened off an outdoor type of corridor which was tiled and a bit noisy when people walked past later that night. A free breakfast was included which was served in the Chinese resturant onsite. It was ok but no cereal, just scrambled egg and sausage with some toast. at a price of $74 per night plus $10 tax it was not bad but you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent! Couldn't ask for better service.”
Reviews.Author: Joel D
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 days and 3 nights and I can honestly say Executive Inns know how to treat their customers right. Professional and courteous staff that make your stay a pleasure. Special thanks to Christian Gaw for going the extra mile in making sure we had the best room possible and met all our needs during our stay, be it getting around, or bringing us plates and utensils. The suites are spacious and close to everything you need; car rentals, shops and restaurants, and of course the airport. If you need a car during your stay, check out Enterprise Car Rental literally a block away from the hotel. Very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Not clean but friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: DionneTravels
Reviews.Content: Tried one room, so dirty I couldn't bare the thought of anyone in my family sleeping in the room. Moved to new room, still felt dirty. Lots of dust, dirty walls and floor. Bed sheets had stain and little holes. Major "heebee jeebee's"! Staff very nice but would NEVER stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel near the airport”
Reviews.Author: tammy0815
Reviews.Content: We have an early flight so we decided to book at the executive inn express. The hotel is very convenient, near the airport, and shuttle bus is prompt and courteous. Hotel staff is very pleasant and helpful esp. Sami who helped and assisted us in making our stay enjoyable. Rooms are nice,clean and very affordable. We'll be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel near the airport”
Reviews.Author: BCtourists
Reviews.Content: We needed a room near the Vancouver Airport so that we could catch an early flight out. After comparing several hotels we decided on the Executive Inn Express and were not disappointed. Some of the features of the hotel are: - free shuttle to/from the airport (about 10 minutes drive) - walking distance to the skytrain (about 10 minutes) - excellent service at check-in/check-out - 24-hour front desk - nice clean rooms with comfortable beds - cooked breakfast (eggs, bacon, toast, juice, coffee/tea) included in the room rate The rate for a queen room was $70 with no extra charges. We also asked to leave some bags at the hotel while we were away for two weeks and this was no problem at all - locked up and safe until we returned. We would stay at this hotel again with no hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Overnight Oasis”
Reviews.Author: Logjam2650
Reviews.Content: We used this little gem of a hotel for an overnight stopover. Not only that, but we used it for long term parking while we flew off to Mexico for a week. The check in process was friendly and helpful. The room was spacious, clean and quiet. They have a free airport shuttle which starts at 4 am and runs every 30 minutes to the Vancouver International Airport, which is only 15 minutes away. Underground parking was a little tight for my 1/2 ton pick-up, but quite manageable. I did meet the security guard when I picked up my vehicle which was reassuring. We were advised not to leave anything visible in the vehicle, which makes good sense as the parking is accessible to anyone. We didn't save much over the official long term parking rates, but the Airport parking authorities charge a whopping 33% tax on top of the daily rate, so we saved that at least. All in all a pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Sleep and ride”
Reviews.Author: ossykid
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night prior to our trip to Mexico, the room was O.K. but the restaurant was closed. We parked the car there for 7 days and used their airport shuttle which runs every 30 mins on the hour. We inquired about the free hot breakfast and were told it didn't start until 7 a.m, but as we were leaving at 6 a.m. they would provide a continental breakfast. At 5.30 a.m. we were told there was no breakfast available, not a big deal but disappointing, however when we returned 7 days later the shuttle left us freezing at the Vancouver airport for almost an hour. The only forgiving feature was that there was no charge to park for 7 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Friday 9th December”
Reviews.Author: David I
Reviews.Content: A fantastic place to stay, rooms were superbly clean, staff most attentive, and the welcome at check in was spectacular, thanks Aliah. I would highly recommend.............

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious Visit”
Reviews.Author: priti k
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is very luxurious with all the amenities. The rooms are big. Nice hospitality with helping staffs and executives.

Reviews.Title: “not worth the price and quality”
Reviews.Author: kingjkhan
Reviews.Content: the only good thing about this hotel is how close its to yvy airport however if i had known how crap it is, i wouldnt have stayed here rude staff, terrible quality room, springy beds not worth the high price at all

Reviews.Title: “Overnight stay for airport”
Reviews.Author: happycamper15
Reviews.Content: We booked this place for an airport overnighter based on tripadvisor comments. We paid a budget/moderate price which usually requires some compromise. This is an older property in a commercial/industrial section of Richmond. It seemed safe though. The airport shuttle was prompt and helpful. Check-in was outstanding. The room was good for its age and the housekeeping was impeccable! For this price I expected to find a blemish or two, and I also usually have to open a window to air out some odors. Our room was a pleasant surprise: the linens were sparkling clean and the room was well maintained. This was a nice discovery that offers great value and excellent staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: uprivercamaleon
Reviews.Content: While this hotel is fairly average in style and everything else... the location is great, just minutes from a casino, easy driving distance to downtown, the airport and the ferry, we found it very easy to get everywhere we needed to go. The staff had some English problems, but the free shuttle service from the airport is good, friendly driver. We were not necessarily overly impressed with the hotel, but our experience with the restaurant was fantastic, the food was good every morning, and the absolutely lovely lady who runs the restaurant hugged us on our last morning and told us to come back. Such great and friendly service from her, we will be talking about her for a long time to come!

Reviews.Title: “another great stay thanks executive inn express”
Reviews.Author: candycat272
Reviews.Content: we just returned from mexico and used the hotel both as a pre trip stop over and after trip stop over and both nights we received excellent and professional service from front desk staff and the housekeeping. The hotel shuttle was another great bonus we had two rooms booked for our 8 travel members and got rooms side by side and they were the queen kitchenetts rooms were very clean and comfortable on both ends of our trip. No complaints of noise from any one is our group once again another great stay thanks we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Good location in Richmond”
Reviews.Author: Ydnar
Reviews.Content: As with any room, getting a deal means a 'better rating'. This property was no exception, having been emailed a reduced rate offer I snapped it up and it was good value for the money spent. No problem finding a (free) parking spot and check-in/out was quick and without incident. The room was typical 'mid-range', including a decent TV, fridge, and free wireless internet (slow at times). This is a great location if you are going to the airport, and also if you are trying to access the River Rock (casino resort), or the Skytrain station adjacent, they are both a 5 minute brisk walk away. Also, Costco is adjacent. I didn't try the free breakfast, and check-out was a decent 12 noon.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good people, but smoked in rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Mel C
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very convenient to the airport, and to major highways. We booked two Queen Suites, which were quite large with all the basic amenities. The major problem is that both of the suites we booked, were supposed to be non-smoking, but both rooms smelled strong of smoke. It was obvious that their non-smoking policy is not enforced, and the rooms were not effectively cleaned when smoking took place in them. There is an inner courtyard, and I found hotel guests smoking away in the courtyard which permeated the whole facility. So if you don't like smoked in rooms, I couldn't recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good stop-over-between-flights airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChuckAtlanta
Reviews.Content: Roughly comparable to a Holiday Inn Express/Hampton Inn/Fairmont, though not as new as most of those these days, and unlike those it has a restaurant and bar. The configuration is three stories, all rooms with an entrance from a balcony that surrounds and faces onto a central courtyard with plantings.The single elevator is at the lobby end of the courtyard, restaurant and bar are opposite.The upper floors have larger rooms as their balconies hang out over the courtyard a bit. The room I had on the northbound leg of the trip was a first floor queen, a little on the small side but perfectly adequate, clean, with a good shower and lots of hot water, breakfast coffee maker, small refrigerator, and iron and ironing board in the closet. Going south a week later I had a third floor queen that was larger, with a separate sitting area, and equal to the other in all other respects. Unlike a previous reviewer's experience, there was free wireless in both rooms with a strong signal, and in the larger room there was optional wired internet, which I didn't use. Additionally there was a PC with a printer in the lobby, so one could print out airline boarding passes. Like many older properties, they still use beds with sheets, blanket and bedspread, instead of the douvet with a little accent blanket over the foot; this is either good or bad depending on your preference. Food in the restaurant was good- in both directions I had to leave before breakfast was served, but I ate dinner there both times, and had a drink at the bar. Prices for food and drink were a little higher than I'm used to, but that may be the difference between suburban Atlanta USA and airport-area Vancouver BC. The bartenderess was a beginner, as recognizable by the way she carefully measured each drop of liquor, with no "after-splash" as most more generous pro bartenders provide; she doubled as the waitress/hostess in the sparsely populated dining room. Free shuttle runs 10 minutes earlier than the advertised time. On both occasions that I used it to get to the airport, I was told by the desk clerk that "the shuttle leaves on the hour and half hour, but be here fifteen minutes early," and sure enough, it came 10 minutes early and left as soon as loaded.

Reviews.Title: “Okay Hotel”
Reviews.Author: islandguy07
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel 2 weeks ago at the start of our trip to Mexico. We wanted a hotel close to the Vancouver Airport that had a free shuttle. I have seen the hotel numerous times I have been to Vancouver but have never stayed there. It looked pretty nice. We checked in about 3pm which was right at check in. The girl at the front desk was friendly but I wasent sure if she knew what she was doing or knew what rooms were available for the room type we wanted. Anyways that was fine we went up to our room on the 3rd floor. It was a queen room. A little small but the room was good. I thought the hotel corridors were a bit dated and at night they were not well lit. Very dark through the corridors. The info book in the room said there was a drink and snack machine on the second floor so I went down there to get some snacks and a drink and there was only a drink machine which annoyed me. Second time I went to get a drink from the machine later that night what I wanted they were out of, which annoyed me again. But the biggest annoyance with this hotel was the internet. They had a wired internet and the lady and the front desk said they dident have wireless when we checked in but I could tell there was wireless cause of the connections maybe not available to the whole hotel which if your going to have wireless make it available to whole hotel and who still has wired internet now anyways. After numerous calls to the front desk to try and get the internet working cause it wouldent work we finally got it working. But I was pretty annoyed after that. The breakfast was okay. It wasent big which was fine for me. But also wondered about the free wine reception was never told about that when we checked in. All in all it was an okay hotel for a overnight stop but not sure if I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: shamsham s
Reviews.Content: fair priced nice room . try to get rooms away from main road short walk to sky train

Reviews.Title: “UGH!”
Reviews.Author: IndianapolisVictoria
Reviews.Content: I travel extensively and this ranks in the top 5 worst hotels I've ever encountered. The room, the "restaurant"(?), the entire facility in general. It was so unkempt, we decided not to chance sleeping in the beds. It was booked by a travel agent and if it hadn't been 1:00am when we arrived, we would have found something else or just slept at the airport. Not sure who is giving the place rave reviews but pretty sure its not an actual paying guest.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate Airport Destination”
Reviews.Author: RexT
Reviews.Content: I had selected this hotel based on proximity to YVR, cost, and TripAdvisor commentary. Overall, it met our needs. Unfortunately, having just stayed in far superior accommodation elsewhere in BC and Washington during this vacation, the EIE was a bit sad and drab. It was as if we had dropped several levels down in our choices. Having said this, I grew to appreciate the EIE during our one night stay. Really, it provides everything one needs, including free internet and free breakfast (which I was unable to sample). Nothing particularly interesting or exciting or memorable about the stay, but for the price, I do consider that it provided decent value with NO significant weaknesses. The neighbourhood is lacklustre - near a Costco, gas station, etc. EXTREMELY handy to the airport. Staff was competent and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Be prepared for confusion”
Reviews.Author: ReadLisaRead
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the night before needing to be at the airport for an overseas flight. Location, shuttle service, cleanliness and choice of room styles was excellent. However, we found ourselves shaking our heads in confusion at some of the things we encountered. Begin with the highlighted "wine reception". I chose the hotel for the proximity to the airport, but the "free wine reception" swung my decision to the Executive Express. So, we checked in, rooms, as I say, were fine--lots of room for the four of us, and the included breakfast meant we would get away for our flight well rested and fed. Hmmmm. So, at the appointed hour, we wandered down to the lounge/restaurant and.....found it locked. So, we sat in the patio for a few minutes and eventually an awkward server turned on the open sign and let us in. We told him we were there for dinner, but could we also participate in the Wine Reception. He became a bit flustered, because the kids couldn't come into the attached lounge. He bumbled about for a moment and decided we could sit near the lounge, and he could bring us our wine. Okaaaaay. Then came the best part of the advertised Free Wine Reception. It was determined that we would both like red wine, which provided a choice of merlot or Shiraz. We chose the Shiraz, which turned out to be our bad luck, as.....they were out of Shiraz. So, from a 1/3 bottle of merlot, he squeezed two small glasses. Awesome. Then we placed our dinner orders,, and THEN,and only then, did he tell us the chef hadn't turned up yet. By now, we really would have preferred to pound our free plonk and gone elsewhere, but it seemed like the awkward server had really bonded with us, so we stayed put, the chef showed, and a really mediocre dinner was not enjoyed by the four of us. One other table of perplexed diners came in later, and the rush was almost enough to do the awkward server in, but he prevailed. He did confess to us that he wasn't a server at all, just worked at the hotel to help out his aunt and uncle. He was certainly pleasant, and he turned up on time' unlike the chef. The next morning, the awkward took a drastic turn to downright uncomfortable. Our awkward server was obviously at his day job, leaving the service of Free Breakfast in the hands of a brusque elderly Asian woman, who did such bizarre things as lock the door (yes, we had to knock, and another customer got up and let us in). As it was not apparent how the breakfast worked, the lady would yell "I bring you sausage egg and toast, no menu!! You sit, I bring!!!". Well, bring us juice, coffee, scrambled eggs and sausage, she did, as well as toast and jam, and for a free breakfast, it was good value. Fortunately, we got in and sat at a clean table and got our free breakfast. Those who came after us were not so lucky. No tables were being cleared, and by the time we left there were no less than 10 people waiting. Angrily. We thanked the harsh lady and made haste for our shuttle to the airport. Do book a room here if the rate is less than others in the area, or if you require a spacious/family room. Do not chose this site for the Free Wine reception or the Breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service and even worse sleep”
Reviews.Author: Yelram
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff were not overly helpful or friendly; the room smelled like old cigarettes; the bed and pillows were uncomfortable. For over $100 dollars a night the only positive things I can say are that the room was large and the shower pressure was decent.

Reviews.Title: “Really poor quality and over priced”
Reviews.Author: jraja123
Reviews.Content: Bad quality room, unfriendly and nonhelpful staff, free shuttle – to and from the aport, free breakfast but not buffet- restaurant staff very nice though, free parking, overall really rubbish for $100 a night! Only choose it due to promixity to aiport and if u dont find anythin else

Reviews.Title: “Just what we needed”
Reviews.Author: Iowa_is_my_home
Reviews.Content: While this hotel is not lavish, it is clean and comfortable and well located for the airport. We were attracted by the free airport shuttle, and there was plenty of parking. There were a few restaurants within a short drive. It was very adequate for our needs. Service was efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Great 2nd Choice within 5min to airport, 5min walk to Skytrain”
Reviews.Author: WhiteSand64
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel when everything downtown booked. Clean, Quiet, Comfortable Room. Staff were helpful, friendly, and courteous. Location is awesome. 5min to airport with complimentary shuttle. 5 minute walk to skytrain = 20min ride to downtown core. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Place - great service! - big rooms!”
Reviews.Author: rsteil
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough about the staff - extremely courteous and helpful. Clean and large rooms - twice the size of the rooms you'll get downtown and you don't have to pay for parking! There must be 20 restaurants within a 2 min drive and the skytrain is a walkable distance. All in all - awesome place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, good value, and great service!”
Reviews.Author: wonderwoman1st
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised on arriving here for my last night in Vancouver, before flying away via the airport the next day. Great reception and very polite, gave us our room before the check in time, and others that arrived (not related to us) also got given their rooms early. The room was lovely and clean and had exactly what I requested, microwave and a fridge as I have a toddler who needs his warm milk first thing in the morning and last thing at night, very cosy, no noise, overlooking the car park and beyond, so I could see my friend arriving to see me off on my last day too which was great. The restaurant meal and service at dinner time was better than I expected too, had a lovely healthy dinner, and am looking forward to having my breakfast there tomorrow. My friend was also impressed with this hotel which is also nice to look at as you come in. Overall, I highly recommend this hotel, great value - only cost me $71 for the night plus tax which is not much, including b.fast, and for what we got plus the exceptional service, I have no idea why others complain via the reviews on here, but can only put it down to the fact that some people are never satisfied with anything and will always complain about something. While some of us appreciate a great service and here you get exactly that. The internet is only $5 for 24 hrs, though there is free access to a computer as you come in at the reception area too, well worth it. I also noted the airport shuttle arrive just outside the entrance of the hotel, very convenient, it does not get easier than this, and was told it comes every 30 mins from 4am to midnight, but get downstairs 10 mins beforehand to ensure to get on it when it arrives, can not be more fair than that, the shuttle to the airport is also free with the hotel booking. Overall this is great value for all you get while here, and a great place to relax and unwind too, in my case for our last night before moving back overseas.

Reviews.Title: “An Unexpected Find”
Reviews.Author: foreigncarnut
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel quite by chance seven years ago and haven't stayed anywhere else (in Vancouver BC) since. The location is great. The staff is very professional, yet friendly and helpful. The rooms are large, clean and very comfortable. We like the flexibility of having a kitchen, so we can pack a gourmet lunch to take to the car show we attend each year. Executive Inn Express is an incredible value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable rooms, Very Near to Airport and Sky Train Station. Friendly Staff. Nice Experience :)”
Reviews.Author: sudin333
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Executive Inn Express, Richmond, BC for a month. A clean and modern hotel with very hospitable staff. Rooms were exceptionally large for a more budget-priced hotel with comfortable beds and recently renovated bathrooms. Overall a great airport hotel with clean accommodations, friendly staff, and exceptional value. Also it very near to Bridge port Sky train station. The only problem i faced is low Internet Speed for video chatting, hope this will be rectified by this time. Overall it was good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very reasonable place to stay and close to the airport.”
Reviews.Author: verduzco6
Reviews.Content: The hotel was close to the airport which was great for a layover flight. Older hotel but well maintained. Nice clean room. The price was very reasonable and it came with a continental breakfast which are the 2 reasons I chose this hotel. The shuttle does only run until midnight so we did have to take a cab to the hotel. $12 from the airport. I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay.Near the airport.”
Reviews.Author: nasrinmohamed
Reviews.Content: We were on our way to Mexico and stayed the night at the Executive In Express. We arrived quite late and when we arrived the front desk Manager, Samy knew exactly who we were and greeted us with our name. That made us feel really welcome. He was very polite and always had a smile on his face. We parked our car there and the next morning the hotel shuttle took us to the airport. Was right on time both ways. On our return Samy was again there, very helpful as before. Just the service from Samy and the General Manager, Mr. Lam made it all worthwhile.

Reviews.Title: “clean room,great value,location,and airport transport”
Reviews.Author: norr_cal
Reviews.Content: After a trans Pacific flight,Executive Inn Express Richmond picked me up and delivered me back to the airport after a relaxing night in a clean, well appointed Room 107, comfortable bed and internet access before heading across to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Generally unpleasant.”
Reviews.Author: fluffypuppycatsLOL
Reviews.Content: Uncaring and unhelpful staff. Room felt like it probably hadn't been used in years (smelt moldy). Dank and dingy bathroom. Lots of noise from the highway and airport. We only stayed here because they offered free parking while we were away - next time I'll stay at a decent hotel and pay for parking.

Reviews.Title: “super great service great service”
Reviews.Author: candycat272
Reviews.Content: we recently stayed at the executive inn express on a trip to mexico, check in was quick and easy was able to add another guest to the room without no problems or charges and was given a complementy roll away bed free of charge. we parked and stayed with no problems to vehicle what so ever. the rooms are basic but clean and have a coffee maker and fridge in all rooms. shuttle service to and from the airport was efficiant and on time. the corridors are cooler but that is what one would expect from an open corridor and did not have any issues with noise from luggage in hallways or from the road and we were in a corner room would recommend this hotel to travellers with family. oh ya and the hot tub worked great

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stop Over Hotel for Air Travel”
Reviews.Author: mamabear2010
Reviews.Content: The location and service this hotel offers is perfect when you need a stopover for air travel. We were on a one week vacation and stayed one night both going and coming home. What more could you ask for when they offer free parking for the week you are away, excellent and efficient shuttle service back and forth to the airport and they will keep your keys and cell phones while you are away. Check in is always quick and easy. Access to the hotel from the highway is easy. The rooms are clean and offer everything you need. We have used this hotel twice and will definately come here again the next trip we take.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, couldn't have asked for better”
Reviews.Author: JohnYvonne56
Reviews.Content: Had a great experience on the short stopover. Sami at the front counter was so kind curtious, and a wonderful host. We could not have asked for anything better.

Reviews.Title: “perfect stop over hotel”
Reviews.Author: nmeredith
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights-when we left and on our return. Check in was efficient and friendly, rooms were clean and beds were comfortable. Took advantage of the park n fly option and they even looked after our keys for us. Shuttle was efficient, and hotel has easy access to the airport and the highway. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and Value!”
Reviews.Author: Reg_and_Abs
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Executive Inn Express in Richmond for one night. We were attending a dinner at the Boathouse Restaurant and watching a show at the River Rock Showroom. The location of the Hotel and proximity to both venues was the number one reason for our selection and we were not dissapointed! A short $5 cab ride to each venue was well worth the nights stay as we live in Langley and a cab ride home would have cost us more than staying in the hotel. The hotel itself was neat and the room was clean and well kept. It was very quiet and we got a great nights sleep. Highly Recommend!

Reviews.Title: “not so good”
Reviews.Author: travelingwifre
Reviews.Content: For the 97 dollars we paid for 4 people for one night.... i suppose it was ok.... The beds were horrible, not only were they hard mattresses, but they had no fitted sheets on the bottom, so by half way through the night, we were sleeping on bare matress... YUCK! also 4 of us shared a room, and the bathroom door didnt even close, the handle was broken... the plumbing in the building was unbelievable loud, waking us up ever time someone flushed a toilette or showered.... We did how ever get to leave our car there for 8 days during our trip at no charge... so i guess if you are traveling on a budget and just need a quick place to rest and a place to leave you car, go for it... but i you want a nice quiet relaxing stay... i suggest stay somewhere else!!! Next time I will spend more... and get more!

Reviews.Title: “not that great”
Reviews.Author: tujo
Reviews.Content: there were stains in the stucco on the ceiling the free breakfast consisted of toast and coffee room was damp the internet in the lobby was slow and took my moeny without giving me the time to said

Reviews.Title: “Were very pleased with our room”
Reviews.Author: CoverBrooke
Reviews.Content: Room was clean, nicely furnished, quiet, well equipped and had a very well equipped kitchenette. Bed was comfortable. Everything seemed well thought out. Airport shuttle worked well. Had a good nights rest. No free WiFi Breakfast minimal - two slices of toast and a drink. Good value near the Airport.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: pjhrpr
Reviews.Content: The shuttle from the airport was at warp speed ans scary on the way there but sedate and calm on return. The reception staff are professional and helpful. The room was very clean and we were given a studio at no extra cost..big and spacious and everything was in tip top shape and worked! The complimentary breakfast was a disappointment...flabby toast and scant butter and spreads served very ungraciously and skimpy coffees.. But I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting an inexpensive but good overnight sleep in a very comfy bed. Thanks...Exec.Inn Richmond

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for good reasons”
Reviews.Author: Dorian33
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Riverrock Casino for a concert last year. This year we picked this hotel for a much more economical price. Surprising, it is better than I expected. It is a good location with free shuttle to airport and casino. Room is spacious and clean. Everything else is standard. The best part is it is closed to skytrain which can take us anywhere in greater Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Beamer318
Reviews.Content: Despite how it looks on their web site, this is a run down hotel. Their web site states you will have a room overlooking the courtyard but all the rooms overlook a hallway that overlooks the courtyard. There is a small window in which you can just catch a glimpse of the courtyard. The elevator mirror was cracked and repaired with duct tape. The spa was luke warm at best. The continental breakfast consists of toast, coffee, and juice. We could hear live birds chirping in the kitchen which has to be again health regulations. When we returned home we received an email from the hotel asking us to put a review on trip advisor if we enjoyed our stay. Rather than place a review here I wrote to the hotel and told them my concerns but it's 2 weeks later and no response so I am taking their advice and placing a review ... not the one they were hoping for. Don't waste your money!

Reviews.Title: “Classy with a great price”
Reviews.Author: johnr79
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at many hotels/motels in thr USA and Canada and don't remember any with glasses for water (or whatever) in the room and real coffee mugs (not plastic) for the coffee, Have you ever had your complimentary continental breakfast served to you before? They did it here. Juice toast and coffee were nice but an additional choice of bagels and cereal or waffels would have been a bit better. Metal utensils instead of plastic helped me add the word classy. We really appreciated the early booking they gave us as we had to return a rented car and had no place to wait till the usual motel 3PM time. John and Eleanor from Manotick Ont.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, need better services”
Reviews.Author: Choumi1983
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, Nice environment Nice Restaurant with friendly hostess, Front desk staffs are NOT friendly, only one girl was ok, all the others did not even want to anser your questions! I will still recommend this hotel because of its convenient location and nice environment.

Reviews.Title: “5* FOR THE PRICE EXCELLENT VALUE”
Reviews.Author: Brats
Reviews.Content: I am giving the Excecutive Inn Express the full 5* not because it is 5* but because for the VALUE it definitely is Aug $80 per night , Shuttle at 4.30am , Includes 7 days parking ( that gets my 5* straight away) Clean,Courteous,Staff Yes I can be picky SMALL TOWELS,.....NO WIFI ( unless you pay) But for the price I can live with both of those things We stayed at either end of our trip we had a 7.20am flight so their 4.30am Shuttle was perfect, we arrived back at 9pm after a long day we were in our beds by 10pm

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good value”
Reviews.Author: Sarit17
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights in this hotel. We didn't stay there much during the day. The room was spacious and clean. The lightening was a bit weak, but not much weaker than in other hotels I visited in the west coast. It has a shuttle to and from the airport which was very comfortable. The sky train was very close and we could be in down town Vancouver in ~ 20 minutes. The hotel was quiet ant had free Wi-Fi (you should ask for the password in the desk). It has not high standards but it is only a 2 stars hotel so it is very good comparing to similar hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: KitimatKid
Reviews.Content: I had read a few negative reviews about this hotel so I was a little worried about staying here, but I have to say none of my fears where realized. The front desk clerk was friendly and I was checked in within minutes. My room was nothing fancy but it was clean and had everything you could need for a short stay. Can't beat the location, 5 minute walk to the River Rock plus they have an airport shuttle if needed. If you want a clean, comfortable, quiet room ,I recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: rayiaz885
Reviews.Content: if you just need a quiet,clean room to sleep this is the place. 4.30 am shuttle to airport was why i stayed there.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Stay Ever!”
Reviews.Author: sleepykoala
Reviews.Content: I've been travelling alot within Canada, from the east coast to the west. It's the worse hotel condition I've ever had. From the pictures on the website, it looks so luxury and worth while to stay, but when you get there, it's totally different. There is only 1 elevator for the building and it is old; actually 'old' is not a big problem but it works in a weird way and it stinks.... that matters! The elevator always go down from Lobby (or the upper floors) to the basement (parking lot) before it goes back up. It is the type of elevator you could picture from the 60s-70s. Other horrible things include insufficient lighting and noise. There is no carpet installed so whoever walks with a suitcase and when there are people/teens running in the hallway (which happens everyday during my stay in both the morning and at night), you'd wonder if you ARE in a hotel or in a community center. One last thing I wanna talk about is breakfast. The receptionist just told me that it's included but when I got to the lounge in the morning (where he directed me at check-in), there were nobody and nothing you can related to 'breakfast'... so I just left and went somewhere else. There were no signs or information about any services so the only reason to stay at this hotel is to have a bed and a room to sleep in, that's all!! don't expect there is any service... this word doesn't exist or mean anything for this hotel... In overall, my feedback to this hotel is: old, stinks, noisy, dark, no service, not secure (as the parking below the building has no security guards nor camera, it's easy to break-in and damage your car, etc.). If you choose to stay here, you risk your life and assets at your own cost.

Reviews.Title: “No amenities as listed, Continental Breakfast insufficient:Coffee, juice and toast”
Reviews.Author: JoTheBookingAgent
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked thru the company phone line. The description that was given of the amenities, caused me to choose this 2 star over another. Although the rooms were fine, the gym was under construction, the hot tub was under construction and so was the sauna. The Restaurant was described as very nice, and was found the opposite. The upside is the skytrain is close to get to good food spots. In the morning , the Continental Breakfast, was simply Toast, coffee and juice. Does that really seem sufficient in description?

Reviews.Title: “The price is right!”
Reviews.Author: Rakosh
Reviews.Content: Travelling light? Moving around fast? Just need a place to shower and snooze? This is it. Hey, you are either cheap or efficient (or both) if you stay here. The staff is helpful and friendly. The internet is not free. The hallways are dirty. The rooms are adequate. The hot tub was empty. Slept great. Close to Vancouver, the airport, golfing,places to eat. This is not a showplace. If you wanted luxury,you could spend a lot more somewhere else. The price is very low; as should be your expectations.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay,great rates”
Reviews.Author: rickyjb
Reviews.Content: stayed for a total of 5 nights,had a great time.They are located close to Canada line,a huge bonus.They upgraded our room for free,we needed a microwave.The king suites are awesome,the queens are a bit smaller but lots of space.They charge for internet,but we got it free as an upgrade,,,they are expecting to go free wifi in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “will come back”
Reviews.Author: Nick96
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a night to catch the early flight. I was glad that I picked this hote. The room just renovated and it was nice and clean. The location was very convinent. Walking distance to skytrain station. I will definitely come back again.

Reviews.Title: “yikes!”
Reviews.Author: BC_CanadaWx_chick
Reviews.Content: I don't know of any executive who would stay here. The room we got was not clean - bathroom sink had hair in it and the kitchen sink stopper was full of food and wouldn't even plug the sink to boot! no free internet. the "free continental breakfast" was toast and coffee. the hot tub was broken, and we were not informed of that until we asked where it was. on the upside: rooms are spacious (but dated), free parking and free shuttle to airport.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: Sidney50
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night and left car for one week. Our car was vandalized at the hotel's under cover parking lot. Parked the car infront of hotel camara and a bright light. No help from the hotel reception clerk, took 25 minutes to find our car key. Beside being rude He would not even offer a telephone book for us to find the police phone #. We found out the hotel had several cars vandalized in the past few weeks.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Close To Airport and Casino”
Reviews.Author: pacific8991
Reviews.Content: I stayed with a couple of friends. It was close to the airport. Free shuttle to and from the hotel/airport. If you're looking for a hotel with a free continental breakfast, this is not the place. Even though their website states that they offer a continental breakfast, the only thing you get is a cup of coffee, a cup of orange juice, and a slice of toast. And there is no breakfast area in the lobby like at other hotels. To get this breakfast, you have to go to the onsite restaurant, Brooklyn Steakhouse and Lounge. A waitress brings the breakfast to you. If you want more than the toast, coffee and juice, you have to purchase additional items from the breakfast menu. We had the free breakfast only on our first day, and after discovering what the free breakfast included, we didn't go back. And plus, it really wasn't free because we felt obligated to tip the waitress for bringing us our "free" toast, coffee and juice. Hotel is also close to River Rock Casino. Even though the casino offers a shuttle that makes a stop at the hotel, we just walked to the casino. Only a 5 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “Worst place I've ever stayed.”
Reviews.Author: waunderinggypsy
Reviews.Content: Close to airport, but in an industrial and heavy traffic area. Very poor location. Room had a musty smell. I couldn't wait to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel - you get what you paid for.”
Reviews.Author: yellowplum
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night at this hotel. The decision was based on price and location (in Richmond, relatively close to the airport). Location: in the middle of an industrial/developing area with minimal establishments. need a car to get to nearby amenities (e.g., mall, grocery store...etc) Amenities: The fitness centre has two cardio machines- a treadmill that ceased to function with adjustment of incline; and a basic stationery bike. The fitness centre appears to be an old dining room with poor air-conditioning but the windows can be opened. The room has strong paint odour (not sure if it's paint but smelling like construction materials). In-room internet access costs 5.99CAD/day and the lobby also has a desktop that allows internet access, I believe it is around 2-3cad/hour. Rooms are poorly furnished with old furniture and electronics. Really old carpet, hard to tell if it is clean. One lamp didn't work in our room. The kitchenette in our room is minimally equipped with a very old microwave and a almost-rusty mini refrigerator. Bathroom: Bath towels are very small. Good water pressure of the shower. Like: Free parking. Very good rate for high season. Dislike: poorly rennovated rooms (though not unclean), noise in the morning when housekeeping staff wheeled their carts along the tiled corridor.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay here again........"”
Reviews.Author: leahb
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel using our credit card points for one night before a trip to Mexico and one night upon return from the trip. We had 2 rooms booked each night as we are a family of 6 and they were supposed to be a Deluxe Suite.....well, what a dump. It is so old and dated, the carpet is atrocious, the rooms were not clean and they stunk. The traffic was so loud outside of our two rooms, none of us got any sleep all night long. Upon our return to Canada, we went to the hotel, picked up our vehicle and advised the hotel we wouldn't be staying that night and to ensure it was marked down on their reservations that the room was cancelled. We went to the Hilton Vancouver Airport instead which I would HIGHLY recommend. This hotel, the Executive Express should be a 1 star........we will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “An overall good experience”
Reviews.Author: ButterflyEffect
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner stayed here for 2 nights at the end of October. We had a car so the free parking was very much appreciated. Only problem was that the car was keyed by someone as it was parked in the carpark underneath the hotel. Check in was fast and efficient and our room was large, clean and well stocked. We had a coffee maker in our room with the best hotel coffee I have had to this date (it's usually pretty bad!). We had heating in our room which was good because it was freezing outside! The bed was quite comfortable and we had a good nights sleep. I didn't have a problem with noise outside the room due to the tiled floor, we could only hear the chambermaids wheeling their carts later in the morning but we were usually awake by then. The chambermaids were friendly but annoying. There was no do not disturb sign. Both mornings we had one of them knock and wake us up, we told her we didn't need our room done, then about 20 mins later the second one knocked and tried to come in. I know they're just trying to do their job but it was annoying! Do not disturb signs would be very useful!!! We dined at the resturant the first night and there were not many people there but the waiter was very polite. We even got a free starter salad. We had pasta and it was very delicious. The prices weren't too expensie either. I don't know why people complain about the restaurant, there is nothing wrong with it!!! All in all everything went quite smoothly.

Reviews.Title: “what you expect from a budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: jasperguy
Reviews.Content: pick-up at airport from the shuttle was good, room okay, not super clean but acceptable. Misleading "internet access" ad on the website. You get charged for access, even though the airport has free public access. Plus side was, I was able to get an extended departure, since my flight does not leave till 3 in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “wouldn't stay there again”
Reviews.Author: smallfish_hk
Reviews.Content: Stay there overnight for a concert. Pick this hotel for its price and it location. Hotel need a major upgrade. wall paper peeling off. the insuit ref. are so loud . I have to unplug it. Outside hallway is floor tile so in the early morning when the cleaning mate pushing their crate over the floor tie. It make lould noise. Unless you want to wake up early like 6-7 a.m.. I wouldn't recommand it. But be fair, the price are reasonable, the room is clean, free parking and location is good.

Reviews.Title: “Horrid”
Reviews.Author: Carol100MileHouse
Reviews.Content: Had the worst experience ever. Arrived late May 2, door key would not work, had it re-keyed, still wouldn't work, attendant opened door, room smelled musty, went to use bathroom and NO WATER, called attendant, told to turn on tap and wait 10 minutes, asked to be moved ,told they were full, couldn't I stay in that room. Asked to be moved, told full couldn't do that, I insisted and finally 2 hours later at 2AM the 3rd. we were moved to another hotel along with another patron who's room did not have water either. Unacceptable conduct and shaudy service, with a reservation that was made in February. WILL NEVER STAY THERE AGAIN. I have contacted head office without a satisfactory reply.

Reviews.Title: “Won't do that again EVER!”
Reviews.Author: Mexico2008Bc
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our way back from a trip to Mexico, what a bad way to end a wonderful week! Upon arrival there was a middle aged woman arrinving shortly after us with her elderly mother who was having trouble walking up the front stairs so she ran inside and asked the front desk clerk if there was anyone to help her with her bags- nope! no one to help - so my husband and i offered to give them a hand and placed their bags on a nearby cart with wheels while the woman at the front desk came out from behind the desk and watched us help them and watched as my husband struggled with the door (they had alot of large luggage)- We had arrived at about 10:30 pm and as most people coming in off a flight at that time were really hungry, the restraunt closed at 10:00 so we called room service which happened to also close at 10:00 just like the restaurant- we're really not that choosy so i went to look for a vending machine- no such luck- i mean really doesn't every hotel have a vending machine. the jacuzzi was busted and "Out of Service". The next morning my husband went to make a long distance call and had to call the front desk to activate it. Overall maybe it was just a shocking contrast to the hospitable mexican people who were so prepared to help us even find our way around town. We won't be back to the Executive Inn

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Average Location”
Reviews.Author: kjetzer
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Executive Inn Express, Richmond, BC for two nights while visiting Vancouver. A clean and modern hotel with very hospitable staff. Rooms were exceptionally large for a more budget-priced hotel with comfortable beds and recently renovated bathrooms. The on-site restaurant was overpriced and only seemed to offer typical bar/grill food. Unfortunately, there are not very many restaurants in the area, so I had to walk a good mile or two to find a place to eat that was not fast food. Overall a great airport hotel with clean accommodations, friendly staff, and exceptional value.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Brats
Reviews.Content: We have just stayed one night before an early flight we booked because it was the cheapest hotel that we could find that included 7 days parking. $80 Great Value after reading all the reviews I was a little sceptical,but we arrived 10.30pm to a smiling receptionist, yes a pretty dated hotel but perfectly clean nice big room very clean bathroom tiny towels hard mattress horrible pillows .But its one night perfectly adequate,free Muffin or Toast and coffee at the attached restuarant ,Shuttle arrive exactly the time indicated nice cheerful driver, overall a very nice experience for the price of parking my car at the Park & Fly----we will return these rooms have a fridge hotplate with cutlery and pots and pans etc so if your here for a few days or with children its pretty convienant.

Reviews.Title: “Not Very Good”
Reviews.Author: VicGirl123
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Executive Inn Express Richmond the night before a flight out of the Vancouver Airport. It was one of the worst hotel experiences I have ever had and I travel a lot. To start, I walked into the lobby of the hotel and the smell of cigarette smoke was overwhelming. This is in a city where smoking is not allowed in businesses. Then, I was told that they had no record of my reservation. I had forgotten to print out my reservation before I left the house so I asked if they had WIFI so I could look it up using my laptop computer. They did not have WIFI so I was told I could pay to use the internet kiosk and look it up there. I had no other choice but to pay to use their internet kiosk. Once I had retrieved the reservation number, the person at the desk tried looking the reservation up using that. I was told once again that there was no record of the reservation. At this point, a group of people walked in, smelled the lobby, and loudly complained about the smell before leaving to find another hotel. The person at the desk asked what the rate I had booked was. I told him and he looked at me like I was trying to steal from the hotel and reluctantly agreed to honor it. I was given a key to the room and went to find it. The room was on the third floor. The halway outside of the room was completely unheated (so it felt like it was outside) and it was January so it was really chilly. The hallway also smelled like a gym locker room. Fortunately the room did not smell bad like that and was heated. However, the bathroom was not very clean - the toilet had some dirt on the seat and there were hairs in the bathtub. The room was very big though and there was a kitchen in it which was great. I had booked a park-and-fly rate so I could leave my car parked at the hotel while I was away. At some point while it was parked at the hotel, someone tried to steal my car by trying to pull the lock out of the door. They almost completely destroyed the driver's side door with a crowbar. The hotel was completely unhelpful when I told them about it and didn't even appologize. I will not be staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly good.”
Reviews.Author: rsv
Reviews.Content: We flew into Vancouver around midnight last week and decided to stay close to the airport for the night. Even though there were mixed reviews, I decided to book a room at this hotel and I think it was not a bad decision, The hotel is very close to the airport and the room was decent. The hallway however was dingy and a little scary/shady. Anyway the room was clean and comfortable with two queen beds. It was a surprise that they offered us free breakfast (OK, not a big spread, but enough to get you started - we ordered additional stuff and paid for it). For what we paid - $69 - it was pretty good. We stayed there for the night and stayed elsewhere for the rest of our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel, if possible.”
Reviews.Author: WBinBC
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night in August 2006. Hotel is close to the Vancouver airport but is in major need of an overhaul. The lobby smells badly and has scruffy furniture, the rooms are dirty and old, and the entrance to the lobby consists of your choice of a large number of stairs or a badly-designed rampway (difficult to manouever a luggage cart in). Paid $89 CDN for our room--would recommend looking around for another hotel in the area. The elevator is very dirty, and it seems the hotel has not been cleaned in a long time.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable rooms, Excellent Restaurant & Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I actually found my experience at this hotel to be comfortable and well worth what I paid for my stay of 5 nights. When I checked in, the staff were friendly and were more than willing to answer all my questions about Vancouver tours and local malls. They also recommended a car rental agency for me and called them on my behalf. They arranged for the car rental to come and pick me up too! The room was spacious and I was told that I had a newly remodelled room and it looked new to me. Everything was clean and bright. I also visited their restaurant for dinner and was amazed by the presentation and quality of the steak and it was very reasonable as well. Breakfasts were also very tasty with nice fluffy omelettes. I would recommend this place to my friends as I found my experience positive and well worth what I paid. I had checked around for rates and this was the most reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely horrible, mean staff, disgusting rooms, not clean at all”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My mom, grandmother, aunt and myself decided to do a girls weekend trip to Vancouver and unfortunately booked at this hotel. The rates seemed comparable to other hotels in the area, but the quailty of this hotel was so poor. At check-in, we asked about what the cost would be to upgrade to a suite and decided it would be worth it, boy were we wrong. The room was disgusting. The curtains were falling off and were stained with dirt. The bathroom floor had caked on dirt and the rest of the place looked like it hadn't been cleaned in a while. We were going to use the 2 pull out couches so we each had our own bed, but after pulling out the sofas, we found that all the springs had popped off so the end of the bed touched the ground. The hotel was really noisy as well. There were some questionable guests that were congregating in the corredors, which link to the outside corridor and are not heated. Makes for a brisk and cool awakening on the way to their so called continental breakfast. My mom went down for breakfast at around 7:45am, and found a couple of stale muffins, no drinks, nothing else. When we complained, we were rudely told that all they have to serve is a muffin in order to say they have a continental breakfast, and had nothing to say about the condition of our room. I did write a letter to the manager of the chain who did offer us a gift certificate towards our stay at their sister hotel, the Executive Inn in Richmond, which by the way, I've heard is fabulous. The manager did report shock over the treatment we received by the staff at the hotel. I do not recommend this hotel. With so many other options around the same price, spend a little more and enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “OK for the Price (Cdn$62)”
Reviews.Author: curlermon
Reviews.Content: I stayed there May 11th, cost me $62 plus taxes etc. It's 5 minutes from YVR by FREE shuttle bus. Room was OK, bed was comfortable. TV worked, and the bathroom was clean. The hotel is pretty basic and OK for an overnight. The continental breakfast is served in the restaurant on the main floor. Not a buffet you have to tell them you are there for the FREE continental breakfast, that's just toast/muffin and coffee. It's good enough to start the day. The shuttle bus DOESN'T serve YVR's South Terminal only the main terminal. Taxi is to the south terminal from the hotel is about 10 bucks. I'd use it again unless another one was similar in price.

Reviews.Title: “Not a great choice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The only reason I stayed here is because there was a cheap rate online. Rooms are basic. Hotel is passable. NO AMMENITIES other than a small restaurant on-site. Some rooms have a kitchenette with sink, microwave and bar fridge. My experience: - Remote control for TV would not work. Hotel staff would not come to my room to replace the remote. They said they would, 24 hours later, they still hadn't. I ACTUALLY HAD TO CARRY THE TV TO THE LOBBY TO GET THEM TO PAY ATTENTION TO ME. And even then, they didn't care that I carried it down (it's only a 19" Samsung... not heavy). - Website lists this place as having "wireless internet in public areas". THIS IS A LIE. THEY HAVE NO WIRELESS ANYWHERE. Phone if you don't believe me. I would've stayed elsewhere if I had known to phone first to confirm details that this website should provide accuracy over. - Fitness centre.... what a joke.... it is a dank old conference room with some home-gym Walmart quality weights, etc. - Whirlpool was out of order. - No camera or security in dingy underground parking area. - Heavy stink of bleach on towls and sheets... more than normal for a hotel. You get what you pay for I guess. Beware of this place unless you are looking for a place to sleep and get out quick.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Amy50
Reviews.Content: I am surprized at these reviews! I found the room very clean and comfortable. My husband was shocked I couldn't find any flaws, because I'm always looking for signs of dirty hotels. The staff was wonderful, always willing to send up extra towels or meet whatever needs I had.

Reviews.Title: “No problems here! Very happy!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had no problems here. The underground parking lot was gated and needed key card access to enter. The staff were friendly and accomodating (I arrived late and had no reservation, they found a room for me that was normally left empty because it has a pull down bed that folds down from the wall) and the price was quite reasonable. The room was clean and the bed comfortable. I had been turned away from about a dozen full hotels before coming here and I thought they were a god send!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Be Fooled”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This accommodation is part of a good hotel chain...but must be the worst of the chain... It all begins with the awful smell inside the room, the beds that bring you so close to the ground you wonder if you wouldn't be sleeping better on the ground itself, the dead insects in the bathroom... ...and ends in the morning with a supposed "free continental breakfast", in their restaurant, which really is a choice of orange juice or coffee, and a couple of toasts or a muffin.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Spent the night due to an early departure. Room dingy, sheets smelled musty, room smelled of tobacco (requested non-smoking). Returned 2 weeks later to find that someone broke into our truck while it was parked underneath the building. The management, fortunately, removed a few personal items left in the cab and kept them for us. Unfortunately, they didn't notice that our car also suffered body damage (possibly a separate incident). The management simply shrugged and said they weren't responsible, and they had no insurance to protect us.

Reviews.Title: “I had a horrible time..........”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, my vehicle was stolen in their open car park overnight. The carpark is quite dark, not properly lighted and hence a very decent spot for thieves to break in. And security there was very loose. In fact, the night I stayed, another car got broken into. The most problem I have was the security guard didn't take my case seriously in the morning nor did the front desk which made me really upset even more. The bed I slept on really needs to be replaced. I would say if you stay here, be sure not to drive your own vehicle there.

HotelInfo.Name: Executive Inn Express Richmond
HotelInfo.Address: 9020 Bridgeport Road, Vancouver, British Columbia V6X1S1, Canada
